body_html:
It's far more likely that you're leaking GPU memory through tf.constant in the same way @yaroslavvb identified.

Are you sure you're not adding nodes to your graph every time you call session.run? Can you try finalizing your graph with tf.get_default_graph().finalize() after the first call to session.run?
body_text:
It's far more likely that you're leaking GPU memory through tf.constant in the same way @yaroslavvb identified.
Are you sure you're not adding nodes to your graph every time you call session.run? Can you try finalizing your graph with tf.get_default_graph().finalize() after the first call to session.run?
body:
It's far more likely that you're leaking GPU memory through tf.constant in the same way @yaroslavvb identified.

Are you sure you're not adding nodes to your graph every time you call session.run? Can you try finalizing your graph with tf.get_default_graph().finalize() after the first call to session.run?
